description: Similar in build to the Black-headed Caique, but with a vibrant orange or yellow head, white belly, and green wings. They are equally energetic.
temperament: Goofy, fearless, and always on the move. They have a reputation for being slightly more high-strung than the Black-headed variety. Very cuddly on their own terms.
loudness: Moderate to Loud. Their calls can be very loud and shrill, especially when excited.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Limited talking ability. They are excellent mimics of sounds and can learn many whistles.
dietaryNeeds: A varied diet is key. High-quality pellets, a good mix of fresh vegetables, and a bit more fruit than other parrots to match their high energy levels.
healthPointers: Can live 20-30 years. Polyomavirus can be a concern, so ensure they come from a reputable breeder. Prone to getting into trouble due to their fearless nature.
housing: Can be suitable for apartments, but noise is a factor. A roomy cage is a must, 24"W x 24"D x 30"H at a minimum, to accommodate their acrobatic antics.
